other_title: Concrete Revolutio: Chōjin Gensō The Last Song (Japanese)
コンクリート・レボルティオ～超人幻想～ THE LAST SONG (Japanese)
plot: Titans from outer space, life forms from a mystical world, phantoms and goblins from ancient times, cyborgs created by scientists, relics that rose out of the ruins of ancient civilizations. In another Japan, it's not just a question of “what if”—it's a reality. Some of the superhumans choose to keep their identities a secret, while others bask in their superhuman fame. Jiro Hitoyoshi, member of the Superhuman Bureau, keeps track of their doings.
opening_theme: "Warireru Dōkoku" (割レル慟哭; Smashing Lamentation) by ZAQ
ending_theme: "ALL-WAYS" by Yohske Yamamoto feat. Nami Tamaki
insert_song: "Azuma e Nishi e" (東へ西へ) by Yuuya Asaoka (ep 19)
"Chiisai Glass -Resentment ver.-" (小さいグラス -Resentment ver.-) by Candy Sun (ep 15)
"Hachi no Musashi wa Shinda no Sa" (ハチのムサシは死んだのさ) by Rika Mayama (ep 18)
"Shuppatsu no Uta" (出発の歌) by Cutemen (ep 14)
"Sora ni Hoshi ga Aru yō ni" (空に星があるように) by Takashi Utsunomiya (ep 16)
"Toki no Sugiyuku Mama ni" (時の過ぎゆくままに) by Demon Kakka (ep 21)
